intro: Trigonotis laxa var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, with hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental ground cover. Its botanical features make it both visually appealing and ecologically beneficial in diverse habitats.
